etymology.description: 繁 (numerous/complex) + 体 (form/style) = “complex form” → traditional script.
etymology.interpretation: Literally “complex form,” a shorthand for 繁体字 that contrasts with 简体(字). Commonly refers to the traditional character set used in places like Taiwan and Hong Kong.
etymology.simplification: Only 體 → 体 was simplified, adopting a long-used variant to reduce strokes and ease writing; 繁 remained unchanged.

examples.chinese: 请把网页切换成繁体(請把網頁切換成繁體)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bǎ wǎngyè qiēhuàn chéng fántǐ.
examples.english: Please switch the webpage to traditional characters.

examples.chinese: 他能看繁体也能看简体(他能看繁體也能看簡體)。
examples.pinyin: Tā néng kàn fántǐ yě néng kàn jiǎntǐ.
examples.english: He can read Traditional as well as Simplified.

examples.chinese: 在设置里可以选择简体或繁体(在設置裡可以選擇簡體或繁體)。
examples.pinyin: Zài shèzhì lǐ kěyǐ xuǎnzé jiǎntǐ huò fántǐ.
examples.english: In settings you can choose Simplified or Traditional.
